resources.string: The owner of the company, Orlando Canido, in the beginning had a soda factory and distributed different brands of soft drinks. In the year 2000, it imposed a brand called \\\"Sao\\\", from which it bought the production and distributed it, and due to its name, many people believed that it was an imported soft drink. Some time later, the owner of Sao decided to market his product on his own, without involving Canido.\\n\\nCanido, who had first decided to dedicate himself to the field, changed his mind and went back to the soda business, creating his own brand. The name Manaus arose as competition to the Sao soft drink, because it is the name of another city in Brazil. He says that he regrets this decision:\\n\\nI had to compete with the same brand that he had imposed. So I named her \'Manaus\', because she also seemed Brazilian. I curse the time that Manaus occurred to me. I would have put \'El Pampero\' or \'Las Cataratas\', what do I know, but there was no intention of internationalizing the brand.\\n\\nAccording to a study focused mainly on supermarkets and hypermarkets in the metropolitan area of ​​Buenos Aires, due to the consultant Kantar Worldpanel in 2018, there was a large increase in consumption in Manaus due to the growing tendency to acquire lower-priced brands. The drink incorporated seven hundred thousand new consumer households in the last year, being the one that added the most families within the top 10 fastest growing brands.\\n\\nIn 2019 Manaus acquired the Pindapoy fruit juice company and expanded its plant to 19,000 meters squares.
